title: Members of Congress want White House to quickly nominate new NASA administrator
summary:
Members of the House and Senate called in the White House to promptly offer a new candidate for NASA administrator after the surprise withdrawal of Jared Isaacman’s nomination.

title: Johnson’s Jason Foster Recognized for New Technology Reporting Record
summary: Heading into a recent staff meeting for Johnson Space Center’s Business Development & Technology Integration Office, Jason Foster anticipated a typical agenda of team updates and discussion. He did not expect an announcement that he had been named a 2025 Rookie of the Year – Honorable Mention through the Federal Laboratory Consortium’s annual awards program. […]

title: China’s Cangyu plans mixed-orbit commercial data relay satellite system
summary:
Private firm Cangyu Space Technology is planning a commercial data relay constellation using a novel mix of orbits, signaling continued expansion of China’s commercial ecosystem.

title: Ursa Major secures $32.9 million contract to supply engines for U.S. military hypersonic tests
summary:
Ursa Major will deliver an upgraded variant of its Hadley engine for use in Stratolaunch’s reusable hypersonic vehicle called Talon-A.

title: Live coverage: ULA to launch Atlas 5 rocket with 2nd batch of Project Kuiper satellites for Amazon
summary: The 27 Kuiper satellites will head to low Earth orbit on an Atlas 5 rocket flying in a 551 configuration, using five solid rocket boosters. ULA is targeting liftoff at 1:25 p.m. EDT (1725 UTC) on Monday, June 16.

title: ESA moving ahead with ‘resilience from space’ satellite imaging program
summary:
The European Space Agency is moving ahead with plans for the first phase of an Earth observation satellite system that will have both civil and military uses.

title: NASA sets new potential launch date for Ax-4 mission to ISS
summary:
NASA says a private astronaut mission could launch to the ISS as soon as June 19 as it works to understand an air leak on the station's Russian segment.
